Name: Kismet
Review Text: Waited to dine at Kismet for ages and it didn’t not disappoint. The crispy rice with egg yolk was such a highlight. The salads are perfect using quality and seasonal ingredients. Service was perfect!

Name: Kismet
Review Text: Some of the best food in LA. And very nice staff. Get the fried cauliflower and the salmon! And the flaky bread. And everything, really.

Name: Kismet
Review Text: Nice vibes and friendly staff, original take on Mediterranean cuisine. Loved the carrots and their wine. Rather on the pricey side overall.

Name: Kismet

Name: Kismet
Review Text: Had lunch here and shared three plates. Delicious food! Way beyond my expectations. Everything was seasoned very subtly, I definitely want to come back for dinner.

Review Text: Very good experience. Staff are super nice. A bit expensive for the dishes. Also they like mixing up sweet with salty stuff and I think that sometimes it doesn't work.

Review Text:

Review Text: Food was delicious and there was a decent amount of vegetarian options.  Minus one star for the beer list, it would be nice to have a middle of the road choice between a 375ml Saison and Modelo.  If you're only going to carry two beers, Modelo seems like a strange choice.

Name: Kismet
Review Text: We’ve dined out several times during the pandemic and none have been as enjoyable or delicious as our dinner at Kismet. The ambience, the service, the fusion of flavors, and the attention to detail set this place apart from the rest.

Name: Kismet
Review Text: This place is awesome  the food and the way they treat you.   You feel you are in Mediterraneo amazing views

Name: Kismet
Review Text: Absolutely delicious — great flavours and pairings. Highly recommend kismet!

Name: Kismet
Review Text: THEY DON'T CARE ABOUT COVID - worst experience ever. I've been going there for years and unfortunately had to cancel a dinner reservation for 2 at 1pm the day of. Name: Kismet
Review Text: Delicious food and great service. When you want brunch that is a little different give this place a try. Must try the tahini-nutella toast. Only downside is the parking situation or lack of BUT worth it for the food!

Review Text: I like the atmosphere and the food in this place. But I don't think they should call themselves Mediterranean food. Anyone who's been to a real Mediterranean place will realize that this is fusion. Their portions are very small but food is tasty. It's one of those places I would go for snacks and a drink with a friend.

Name: Kismet
Review Text: Kismet... oh how I was crushin on you from a far. You did NOT disappoint. The service was good but not great, the food was BOMB.

Name: Kismet
Review Text: The menu and service were above our expectations. I absolutely enjoyed the ambience of this place. Excellent restaurant to take my family out for dinner.

Name: Kismet
Review Text: I was really exited to try out Kismet but the service of the employees really left a poor taste in my mouth. Condescending and dry, the whole human interaction was sub-par. A real shame when poor service ruins good food.

Name: Kismet
Review Text:
Great place to have Mediterranean food.

Name: Kismet

Review Text: The food was spectacular, the service is friendly and attentive. The street is a bit busy for outdoor dining.

Review Text: One of my preferred spots for tasty mediterranean food. Service is consistently above par. Prices are decent for the quality. I can see why they have so many great reviews.

Name: Kismet
Review Text: Mediterranean food and service at this location is super good. I really loved this place. Looking forward to returning with my relatives. The place has a great feel to it. Reminds me of a cafe in Chicago I liked to visit.

Review Text: Really fast delivery despite the rain! And the delivery man was very nice. Always appreciate delivery guys on a pouring rain kind of day. The food was great too!! The chicken Adana was perfectly cooked and tasty. Always a favorite!

Review Text: Interior was well designed and has great light by the front windows. The menu could use some work. While the food was plated beautifully, it was overly complicated and a few times too salty. On the other hand, the drinks were delicious.

Name: Kismet
Review Text: Great service. All dishes were outstanding!! Cauliflower, tahine with mushrooms (the best!!), feta salad and sunchoke with pancetta. Amazing selection of natural wines although it gets quite expensive when you add the compulsory 20%. Anyway, highly recommend it.

Name: Kismet
Review Text: I don't know how I wouldn't go to this place all the time if I lived on this side of town. Bright, clean interior with fresh, interesting dishes. A surprise with every order. Name: Kismet
Review Text:
A little pricey for what it is, but delicious.

Review Text: Love it here! Sunday afternoon after 3 is a smaller “snack menu” but everything we got was delicious. The marinated feta is a must as a starter, and get extra bread!

Review Text: Hipster central but the food does not disappoint

Name: Kismet
Review Text: Delicious! They were able to accomodate us, a walk in party of 2. Mind you it was at the back counter space,  but it was totally fine. The service was friendly and attentive, the sommelier really knowledgeable, the food was tasty, and the ambiance was on par. Definitely recommend.

Review Text: mediterranean food, mmm, quality stuff. It was so tasty. I will be back with my friends. Prices were fair for the quality of the food.

Name: Kismet
Review Text: Nice staff, clean and beautiful environment, my chicken salad was super salty. Over priced menu, they charge 20 percent service charge. So if you eat at a fast food place it is much better.

Review Text: Excellent spot for quality Mediterranean food. Certainly worth a return visit. The bill was average for the menu. Food is like a restaurant in Louisville I liked.

Review Text: Small, intimate spot serving a cross between California cuisine and Middle Eastern. Dishes feel familiar but flavors are well developed. Menu is great for sharing!

Name: Kismet

Name: Kismet
Review Text: It's a cool spot but I wouldn't say the food was amazing. I'm not a huge fan of high end tapas style dining where you have to spend an arm and a leg to just feel full. All in all it was a good experience, but I wouldn't say I'd rush back.

Name: Kismet
Review Text: Very expensive and potions are small. It has a super hipster vibe that you can tell your friends you were into before it was mainstream. Dishes are hit or miss. Some are bursting with flavor , other lacking.

Name: Kismet
Review Text: A bit too plain in flavours for our taste. Good and fresh food, though. Scallops were tasty. Not for small budgets. Cosy ambiance at night.

Name: Kismet
Review Text: Upscale hipster vibes. Food was ok, nothing special though (we ordered at least five dishes). Barbari or "Seeded bread" for $5? Come on bruh.

Name: Kismet
Review Text: A tad pricey, but the food is absolutely delicious.  I found the plates to be a little small to share for 2 people, but totally want to come back and try the rabbit plate for 2.  Every dish we tried was super savory and worth a re-visit.

Name: Kismet
Review Text: Mediterranean food... super satisfying. Service is awesome even when they are busy. The staff was very welcoming and observant.

Name: Kismet
Review Text: The food here was excellent. And you must try the deserts. We tried three deserts and they were all great. Even my 16 year old, who is a meat eater,  loved this place.

Name: Kismet
Review Text: This place has everything to make you happy .the food is amazing the service is great. Something new and different but it’s work trying it .LOVE THIS PLACE
